Footnotes:
Sulphur Dioxide (Maximum 24-Hour Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):
Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - World Health Organisation (WHO) Interim Target-2: Sulphur Dioxide <= 50 g/cubic metre (24-hour mean).
Nitrogen Dioxide (Annual Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):
Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: Nitrogen Dioxide <= 40 g/cubic metre (annual mean).
Nitrogen Dioxide (Maximum 1-Hour Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):
Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: Nitrogen Dioxide <= 200 g/cubic metre (1-hour mean).
Particulate Matter (PM10) (Annual Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):

Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: PM 10 (Particulate Matter <= 10 microns ) <= 20 g/cubic metre (annual mean). PM10 levels in 2013 and 2015 were severely affected by transboundary smoke haze from overseas land and forest fires.
Particulate Matter (PM10) (99th Percentile 24-Hour Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):

Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: PM 10 (Particulate Matter <= 10 microns ) <= 50 g/cubic metre (99th Percentile 24-hour mean). PM10 levels in 2013 and 2015 were severely affected by transboundary smoke haze from overseas land and forest fires.
Particulate Matter (PM2.5) (Annual Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):

Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - Singapore Sustainable Blueprint Target: PM 2.5 (Particulate Matter <= 2.5 microns ) <= 12 g/cubic metre (annual mean). PM2.5 levels in 2013 and 2015 were severely affected by transboundary smoke haze from overseas land and forest fires.
Particulate Matter (PM2.5) (99th Percentile 24-Hour Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):

Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Interim Target-3: PM 2.5 (Particulate Matter <= 2.5 microns ) <= 37.5 g/cubic metre (99th Percentile 24-hour mean). PM2.5 levels in 2013 and 2015 were severely affected by transboundary smoke haze from overseas land and forest fires.
Carbon Monoxide (Maximum 8-Hour Mean) (Milligram Per Cubic Metre):

Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: Carbon Monoxide <= 10 mg/cubic metre (8-hour mean).  Carbon Monoxide levels in 2013 and 2015 were severely affected by transboundary smoke haze from overseas land and forest fires.
Carbon Monoxide (Maximum 1-Hour Mean) (Milligram Per Cubic Metre):

Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: Carbon Monoxide <= 30 mg/cubic metre (1-hour mean).  Carbon Monoxide levels in 2013 and 2015 were severely affected by transboundary smoke haze from overseas land and forest fires.
Ozone (Maximum 8-Hour Mean) (Microgram Per Cubic Metre):
Singapore's Air Quality Targets by 2020 - WHO Air Quality Guideline: Ozone <= 100 g/cubic metre (Maximum 8-hour mean).
Notation:
na   not available or not applicable
nec  not elsewhere classified
nes  not elsewhere specified
-     nil or negligible or not significant
Notes
Numbers may not add up to the totals due to rounding.
Data are the latest available at the time of access or download. Some statistics, particularly those for the most recent time periods, are provisional and may be subject to revision at a later date.
Values are shown in Singapore dollars (unless otherwise specified).
